data.q: Which function is used to create a `DataFrame` in pandas?
data.e: The `DataFrame()` constructor is used to create a pandas DataFrame from dictionaries, lists, or arrays.

data.q: Which function is used to read CSV files into a pandas `DataFrame`?
data.e: The `read_csv()` function loads data from a CSV file into a pandas DataFrame.

data.q: Which attribute of a `DataFrame` gives the column labels?
data.e: The `columns` attribute returns the labels of all columns in the DataFrame.

data.q: Which method is used to select the first `n` rows of a DataFrame?
data.e: The `head(n)` method returns the first `n` rows of the DataFrame.

data.q: Which method is used to select the last `n` rows of a DataFrame?
data.e: The `tail(n)` method returns the last `n` rows of the DataFrame.

data.q: Which property of a DataFrame gives the number of rows and columns?
data.e: The `shape` property returns a tuple `(rows, columns)` representing the DataFrame dimensions.

data.q: Which method is used to compute basic statistics like mean and standard deviation?
data.e: The `describe()` method generates descriptive statistics such as mean, std, min, and max.

data.q: Which method is used to merge two DataFrames by columns or indexes?
data.e: The `merge()` method combines DataFrames using common columns or indexes.

data.q: Which method is used to concatenate DataFrames along a particular axis?
data.e: The `concat()` method concatenates DataFrames along rows or columns.

data.q: Which method provides information about the DataFrame including column types and non-null counts?
data.e: The `info()` method prints a concise summary of the DataFrame, including column dtypes and non-null values.
